tealsim.physics.em

Class GaussLawFlux

  • java.lang.Object
    • teal.core.AbstractElement
      • teal.sim.simulation.Simulation3D
        • teal.physics.em.SimEM
          • tealsim.physics.em.GaussLawFlux
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, HasID, TElement, TElementManager, THasPropertyChange, HasFramework, HasEngineControl, TSimulation, HasGUI

    public class GaussLawFlux
extends SimEM
    An application to show the normals and electric fields on the surface of a closed surface to make clear the geometric concepts behind Gauss's Law.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    John Belcher
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • LICvisualizationControl

        VisualizationControl LICvisualizationControl
        Visualization control for LIC visualization. LIC stands for line integral convolution.

      • sphereVisible

        boolean sphereVisible
        Logical value for whether sphere is visible.

      • cylinderVisible

        boolean cylinderVisible
        Logical value for whether cylinder is visible.

      • chargesPresent

        boolean chargesPresent
        Logical value for whether there are any point charges in the scene.

      • numberCharges

        int numberCharges
        Number of charges in the scene, set to 2 for startup.

      • baseFluxMeter

        Wall baseFluxMeter
        Base for the flux meter.

      • fluxmeterbaseLabel

        SpatialTextLabel fluxmeterbaseLabel
        Text label for the flux meter.

      • fluxMeterSizeBase

        double fluxMeterSizeBase
        The size of the square for the base of the flux meter.

      • oneUnitFlux

        double oneUnitFlux
        The height of the flux meter cylinder for the flux due to one unit of charge.

      • screenWidth

        double screenWidth
        The approximate width of the canvas in the standard view. We use this to draw a box around the LIC panel, which consists of four white lines, for contrast/appearance reasons.

      • arrowScaleEfield

        double arrowScaleEfield
        The scale factor for the electric field vectors on our surfaces. Increasing this value makes the field vectors larger.

      • arrowScaleNormal

        double arrowScaleNormal
        The scale factor for the surface normal vectors. Increasing this value makes the normal vectors larger.

      • scaleByMagnitudeBoolean

        boolean scaleByMagnitudeBoolean
        Boolean for whether we normalize E (false) or whether we allow the magnitude to show to some extent (true). The extent to which the magnitude is shown is determined by the variables normMagnitudeFactor and powerMagnitudeScale.

      • normMagnitudeFactor

        double normMagnitudeFactor
        If we scale by magnitude, the normalization factor we use.

      • powerMagnitudeScale

        double powerMagnitudeScale
        If we scale by magnitude, the power of the magnitude we let the scale vary by (less than or equal to 1).

      • GaussianSphere

        Rendered GaussianSphere
        A TEALsim native object for the Gaussian sphere.

      • addActions

        void addActions()
        Method to add actions to application. The actions added are two entries on the pull down help menu and the buttons for adding a positive or negative charge and for deleting all charges.
